educations.schoolName: Georgia State University College of Law

fieldsOfStudy: Economics with minor in Political Science

headline: Assistant Chief Counsel
summary: Specialties: Litigation, Criminal Law, Immigration Law and Political Consulting

positions.description:
-Tried felony burglary similar transaction case to a jury

-Drafted accusations and indictments, presented Bills of Indictment to the Grand Jury, argued Probable Cause hearings, argued Motions to Suppress and entered negotiated pleas

-Assisted in all aspects of trial preparation including completing witness and/or victim interviews, and researching and writing legal memoranda
positions.title: Summer Litigation Intern

positions.description:
-Researched and drafted memoranda in the areas of government affairs, property, athletic, and employment law

-Developed university policy positions on medical research, procurement grievances, and academic due process
positions.title: Graduate Research Assistant

positions.description:
-Tried immigration cases in federal administrative court including bond, arraignment, and Individual Merits hearings (independently handling cases from inception to adjudication)

-Wrote Appellate Brief for the Petitioner to U.S. D.O.J. Appellate Division of Immigration Review
positions.title: Summer Litigation Intern

positions.description: -Consulted State Senate, State House, County Council and City Council campaigns by researching current and proposed legislation, drafting policy memos, and writing direct mail, television commercials, and radio ads
positions.title: Communications Consultant

positions.description:
-Performed research for and edited the following books:
  --"A House Divided"  on American political partisanship by Dr. David Woodard
  --"A Nation of Whispers" on conservative undertones in American politics by Dr. David Woodard and Senator Jim DeMint (R-S.C.)
positions.title: Research Specialist I
